known_issues.title: Lack of Automated Salary Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Current system cannot automatically calculate salary based on actual working days, requiring manual interventions and separate tracking of overtime and unpaid leaves.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat payroll system lacks automated salary calculation based on precise working days. The platform cannot dynamically adjust salaries proportionally when employees work more or fewer than the standard 26 working days.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a significant product gap in automated, attendance-driven salary calculation. The system currently requires manual tracking of overtime, unpaid leaves, and does not support automatic pro-rata salary adjustments per employee.

known_issues.title: Payroll Settings Override Leave Policy Daily Wage Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator in payroll settings intentionally overrides the leave policy formula for unpaid leave. The system displays a greyed-out formula in the leave policy to indicate this override, causing user confusion about which formula is actually being applied.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks clear visual communication about formula override mechanisms. Users cannot easily understand why formulas are greyed out or how payroll settings supersede leave policy configurations.
known_issues.gap_statement: No synchronized mechanism exists for daily wage formula configuration between leave policy and payroll modules. Manual alignment is required.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: System failed to recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission. Deductions were incorrectly based on previous salary configuration instead of current one, resulting in payroll calculation discrepancies.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform could not automatically recalculate pending unpaid leave deductions when new salary configurations were created after leave request submission.
known_issues.gap_statement: Product gap in dynamic salary configuration handling, specifically in automatically updating pending leave deductions when salary configurations change.

known_issues.title: End of Service Gratuity Calculation Incorrect for Leap Years
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system incorrectly calculates service days by using 365 days instead of 366 days for 2024, resulting in an inaccurate gratuity amount. The correct calculation should include 366 days for leap years.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's gratuity calculation logic does not automatically adjust for leap years, causing inaccurate service period calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in the EOS gratuity calculator's ability to dynamically handle leap year calculations.

known_issues.title: Pro-Rated End of Service Amount Calculation Error
known_issues.issue_explanation: End of Service (EOS) calculation is producing incorrect pro-rated amounts due to a rounding or decimal precision error. The daily wage formula (basic + allowances / 30) is configured correctly, but when calculating pro-rated EOS amounts, the system consistently shows amounts that are less than expected by 0.1 or 0.2 decimals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform's current daily wage calculation engine has a decimal precision limitation that causes systematic undercalculation of pro-rated amounts.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a potential product gap in the precision of financial calculations, specifically in pro-rated salary computations.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Complexity
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation methodology differs from manual calculations, specifically in handling partial years above 5 years of service and leap year day counting. The calculation involves segmenting service periods, applying different daily rates (21 days per year for first 5 years, 30 days per year above 5 years), and using specific day count methodologies for incomplete years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Calculation logic requires precise understanding of service duration split and daily wage computation | Need for more detailed, user-friendly explanation of gratuity calculation logic with worked examples showing service duration calculation for partial years and leap year handling.

known_issues.title: Gratuity Calculation Discrepancy with Leap Year Day
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system's gratuity calculation may not consistently handle February 29th in leap years, causing a potential one-day discrepancy in service duration calculation. The system calculated 912 days, while the manual calculation included 913 days (accounting for the leap day).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leap year day inclusion in service duration calculation is not transparently handled
known_issues.gap_statement: Need clear documentation on how leap year days are counted in service duration calculations

known_issues.title: Days Worked Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates 623 days instead of 622 days when computing employee service tenure, causing a slight difference in gratuity calculation. An extra day appears to be added to the total working days count.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Minor discrepancy in days worked calculation method

known_issues.title: Inflexible Daily Wage Calculation Method
known_issues.issue_explanation: Platform uses a fixed daily wage calculation of (Basic Salary / 30), which does not align with alternative client calculation methodologies like (Basic × 12 / 365).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage divisor is hardcoded to 30 days and cannot be modified
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of flexibility in daily wage computation methodology

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: System calculates leave salary based on predefined policy configuration, which may not align with user expectations about calendar days and prorated calculations. Users might misunderstand how daily wage is divided (31 vs 30 days) and challenge the resulting prorated salary amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary calculation is rigidly tied to predefined policy configurations that may not flexibly adapt to varying month lengths or specific employee scenarios.
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation about how leave salary calculations are performed, including clear documentation about daily rate divisor configurations and policy-driven calculations.

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Accrual Report Calculation Inconsistency
known_issues.issue_explanation: The daily wage calculator's 'working days' setting causes monthly fluctuations in leave salary accrual calculations. The daily wage rate changes based on the number of working days in each month, leading to inconsistent cumulative totals.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Monthly working days affect daily wage calculations, causing variations in leave salary accrual reports
known_issues.gap_statement: The platform lacks a straightforward way to maintain consistent daily wage calculations across months

known_issues.title: Leave Salary Proration Calculation Discrepancy
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates leave salary and salary proration using independent daily wage configurations with different divisors (30 vs 30.42 days), causing calculation mismatches. The client expects a consistent daily wage formula of (Basic salary + allowances / 30.42 days), but the system uses separate configurations.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Leave salary and salary proration daily wage calculations are configured independently and may use different divisors.
known_issues.gap_statement: No unified daily wage calculation method exists across leave salary and salary proration scenarios.

known_issues.title: Proration Calculation Confusion
known_issues.issue_explanation: User initially misunderstood how working days are calculated based on work week configuration. The system was calculating correctly, but the user did not initially understand that their specific work week (NVK Operations) had all 7 days configured as working days.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration calculation depends entirely on work week configuration

known_issues.title: Incorrect Salary Proration for Offboarded Employees
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system fails to correctly prorate salaries when an employee's departure date is in the future relative to payroll processing. When an employee is offboarded (e.g., Nov 28th) and payroll is processed earlier (e.g., Nov 27th), the system displays the full monthly salary instead of the prorated amount.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Proration logic does not handle future departure dates correctly during payroll processing
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of robust date-sensitive proration logic for employees with future departure dates

known_issues.title: Duplicate Payroll Deductions After Leave Recalculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: When an unpaid leave request is approved and transaction submitted, then the daily wage calculation is changed and the transaction deleted to recalculate, the system creates duplicate deductions—one with the old calculation and one with the new. Moving the leave request back to pending/accepted does not resolve the issue. Even after deleting the unpaid leave request entirely, the unpaid leave deduction persists in payroll deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform lacks robust synchronization logic between leave management and payroll deduction systems. When leave transactions are modified or deleted, the payroll deduction module does not automatically reconcile or remove associated deductions.
known_issues.gap_statement: There is a clear product gap in leave-to-payroll transaction management, specifically around handling recalculations, deletions, and status changes of leave requests without creating orphaned or duplicate deductions.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Mismatch
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system experiences data synchronization issues between Time Off and Payroll modules when public holidays are added after leave requests. This causes inconsistent daily wage calculations that cannot be retroactively corrected, resulting in incorrect salary deductions.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform lacks real-time synchronization between Time Off and Payroll modules, preventing automatic recalculation when public holidays are added after leave requests.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for module communication enhancement to ensure accurate working days calculation and consistent salary deduction across different system configurations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation Methodology
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a custom daily wage divisor (30.42 days) instead of calendar days, which can produce deduction amounts that differ from user expectations of exact monthly salary.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily wage calculation uses 30.42 days divisor, not calendar days
known_issues.gap_statement: Lack of transparent explanation for complex payroll calculation methods, especially for leave deductions that might exceed expected monthly salary

known_issues.title: Incorrect Days Display in Unpaid Leave Remarks
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays incorrect number of days (31 instead of 29) in the remarks section for February unpaid leave calculations, despite the underlying calculation being mathematically correct.
known_issues.limitation_statement: The platform currently displays incorrect remarks for daily wage calculations in February, showing 31 days instead of the actual 29 days for leap years.
known_issues.gap_statement: Need for a dynamic calendar days detection mechanism that automatically adjusts daily rate calculations and remarks based on the actual number of days in each month, especially for edge cases like February in leap years.

known_issues.title: Incorrect Unpaid Leave Deduction Calculation
known_issues.issue_explanation: Global daily rate configuration overrides policy-specific unpaid leave calculation methods. The system calculates unpaid leave deductions using a global daily rate instead of the configured policy-level method (Basic Salary / Working Days).
known_issues.limitation_statement: Global daily rate settings automatically override individual policy configurations for unpaid leave calculations.
known_issues.gap_statement: The system lacks transparency in configuration hierarchy and prevents policy-level customization of leave deduction calculations.

known_issues.title: Unpaid Leave Daily Rate Shows Incorrect Month
known_issues.issue_explanation: The system displays the daily rate from the payroll processing month (May) instead of the leave occurrence month (April), causing user confusion. The actual deduction amount is calculated correctly, but the displayed daily rate is inconsistent with the leave period.
known_issues.limitation_statement: Daily rate recalculated based on payroll processing month instead of leave occurrence month
known_issues.gap_statement: Need a consistent daily rate display mechanism that preserves the initially calculated rate at leave request time
